p: This article reviews the literature that connects the co-production of knowledge for climate change adaptation with the SDGs, with the aim of identifying how and why processes of co-production may foster climate change adaptation in a broader sustainability context. Knowledge co-production is increasingly emerging both as a key for harnessing science for sustainable development (Cash et al., 2003, Clark et al., 2016, Norström et al., 2020) and as a prerequisite for adaptation to climate change (Dilling and Lemos, 2011), referred to here as adaptation.
